Localized number helpers

Localizes the number helpers of Rails by loading the default options from the language file.

The only exception here is the number_to_currency helper which is reimplemented. This is neccessary in order to overwrite the required strings with proper localized ones from the language file.

Used sections of the language file

  numbers:
    separator: '.'
    delimiter: ','
    precision: 3

The numbers section contains the default options common to most number helpers (number_to_currency, number_to_percentage, number_with_delimiter and number_with_precision). 

  helpers:
    number_to_currency:
      precision: 2
      unit: '$'
      order: [unit, main, separator, fraction]
    number_to_phone:
      area_code: false
      delimiter: '-'
      extension:
      country_code:

The number_to_currency section contains new default options for the number_to_currency helper. In case of a conflict the options you specify here will overwrite the options specified in the numbers section.

The number_to_phone section contains the default options for the number_to_phone helper. You can use all options this helper accepts.

Notes

This feature contains code for Rails 1.1.x and 1.2.x in different modules (Rails11 and Rails12). Code common to all version is located in the RailsCommon module. Depending on the running Rails version the matching module will be included (see end of file). The RailsCommon module will be included afterwards because it uses the version depended number_with_delimiter helper.
